newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Alusaf continues improving aluminium output.
newsitem.headline: Alusaf continues improving aluminium output.

text.p: Output at South African aluminium producer Alusaf's Hillside smelter continues to run well above design capacity at a rate of 495,000 tonnes a year, managing director Rob Barbour told Reuters on Wednesday.
"We are actually producing more than the design capacity. the operating results are of the best in the world," Barbour said.
Barbour said production at Hillside was running at around 495,000 tonnes a year while the design capacity was 466,000.
The 7.2 billion rand smelter was fully commissioned in June this year.
Barbour said Alusaf was working hard to increase production at the older Bayside smelter.
"There we are working hard to modernise the plant and get our costs down. We have made significant steps in that direction," he added.
Alusaf said in August -- when the Hillside smelter was running at 490,000 tonnes a year -- that it expected aluminium production to be around 665,000 tonnes in the year to end-June 1997.
In the year to June 30, 1996, the Bayside smelter continued to operate at full capacity and produced 173,960 tonnes.
Alusaf is a unit of Gencor Ltd.
